step1.sentence: Once you submit the application, the decision is completely out of your hands.

step2.story: Maya had spent weeks preparing her business proposal and finally submitted it to the board. Now all she could do was wait. Her colleague reminded her that the outcome was out of her hands, so she tried to focus on other projects instead.

step3.story: Daniel had done everything he could to save the community garden from being demolished. He had gathered over two thousand signatures, spoken at three city council meetings, and even organized a peaceful rally. But now the final vote was scheduled for Friday, and the decision was entirely out of his hands. He sat on the park bench staring at the sunflowers he had planted last spring, wondering if they would survive another summer. His daughter sat beside him and said, 'Dad, you did your best. Whatever happens, you showed everyone how much this place matters.' He nodded slowly, realizing that sometimes letting go is the hardest part of fighting for something you love.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '당신의 손 밖에 있다'라는 뜻으로, 물리적으로 손에 쥘 수 없는 상태를 표현합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 어떤 일의 결과나 상황을 자신이 통제하거나 영향을 줄 수 없을 때 사용합니다. '내가 어쩔 수 있는 게 아니야', '내 힘으로는 안 돼'라는 의미입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 중세 시대부터 사용된 표현으로, 손(hand)은 권력과 통제력을 상징했습니다. 무언가가 '손 밖에 있다'는 것은 자신의 권한이나 영향력 바깥에 있다는 뜻에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 책임이 없다는 뉘앙스도 포함되어 있어서, 위로의 말로 자주 쓰입니다. 'It's out of your hands'라고 하면 '네 잘못이 아니야, 네가 할 수 있는 건 다 했어'라는 따뜻한 톤을 담고 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I've done all I can — it's out of my hands now.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 나는 할 수 있는 건 다 했어 — 이제 내가 어쩔 수 있는 게 아니야.
